net.happybrackets.device.network

Class NetworkCommunication

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.happybrackets.device.network.NetworkCommunication

  • public class NetworkCommunication
extends java.lang.Object
    This class takes care of communication between the device and the controller. You would mainly use it to send OSC messages to the controller and listen for incoming OSC messages from the controller. However, these methods are both wrapped in the HB class.

      Instantiate a new NetworkCommunication object.

      • NetworkCommunication

        public NetworkCommunication(HB _hb)
                     throws java.io.IOException
        Instantiate a new NetworkCommunication object.
        Parameters:
        _hb - the HB object this object is attached to.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - thrown if there is a problem opening the OSCServer, likely due to the port already being in use.

    • Method Detail

      • send

        public void send(java.lang.String msg_name,
                 java.lang.Object[] args)
        Send an OSC message to the controller. This assumes that you have implemented code on the controller side to respond to this message.
        Parameters:
        msg_name - the message name.
        args - the message arguments.

      • send

                 java.lang.Object[] args,
                 java.net.InetSocketAddress requester)
        Send an OSC message to an Address other than the one we have configured as our controller
        Parameters:
        msg - the message name
        args - the message arguments
        requester - the Address of the device making request

        Send a Built OSC Message to server
        Parameters:
        msg - OSC Message
        target, - where we need to send message

      • addListener

        public void addListener(de.sciss.net.OSCListener l)
        Add a @OSCListener that will respond to incoming OSC messages from the controller. Note that this will not listen to broadcast messages from other devices, for which you should use TODO!.
        Parameters:
        l - the listener.

      • removeListener

        public void removeListener(de.sciss.net.OSCListener l)
        Remove the given OSCListener.
        Parameters:
        l - the listener to remove.

      • clearListeners

        public void clearListeners()
        Clear all @OSCListeners.

      • getID

        public int getID()
        Get the ID of this device, as assigned by the controller. If the controller has not yet assigned an ID to this device then the ID will be -1. IDs assigned by the controller will be non-negative integers, either from a configuration file of known devices or allocated incrementally upon request.
        Returns:
        the ID of this device.

      • sendLogs

        public void sendLogs(boolean send_logs)
        Start or stop sending log messages to the controller. On the first start the current log file contents will be sent. Upon subsequent starts any new log messages will be sent that were created since the last stop. Until the process is stopped, as new log messages appear they will be sent to the controller.
        Parameters:
        send_logs - true to start, false to stop.
